title: Table 1: % Children enrolled in different types of schools. By age group and sex. 2024
description: Enrollment statistics for children in Jammu and Kashmir in 2024, categorized by age groups (6-14, 7-16, 7-10, 11-14, 15-16) and gender. The table compares enrollment percentages in Government, Private, and Other schools, as well as the percentage of children currently not in school.
data: | Age group and sex | Govt | Pvt | Other | Not in school | Total |

title: Table 2: % Children enrolled in different types of pre-schools and schools. By age. 2022
description: Detailed breakdown of educational enrollment for children aged 3 to 8 in Jammu and Kashmir for the year 2022. It distinguishes between pre-school types (Anganwadi, Government pre-primary, Private LKG/UKG) and formal school types (Government, Private, Other), including data on children not attending any institution.
data: | Age | Pre-school | Pre-school | Pre-school | School | School | School | Not in pre-school or school | Total |
| Age | Angan-wadi | Govt pre-primary | Pvt LKG/UKG | Govt | Pvt | Other | Not in pre-school or school | Total |

title: Table 3: % Children enrolled in different types of pre-schools and schools. By age. 2024
description: Educational enrollment statistics for children aged 3 to 8 in Jammu and Kashmir for the year 2024. The table provides percentage breakdowns for Anganwadi, Government pre-primary, Private LKG/UKG, and various formal school categories, alongside data on children not enrolled.
data: | Age | Pre-school | Pre-school | Pre-school | School | School | School | Not in pre-school or school | Total |
| Age | Angan-wadi | Govt pre-primary | Pvt LKG/ UKG | Govt | Pvt | Other | Not in pre-school or school | Total |

title: Table 4: % Children by grade and reading level. All children. 2024
description: Assessment of foundational reading skills for children in Jammu and Kashmir in 2024, arranged by grade level (Standard I through VIII). The table categorizes students by their highest reading ability: Not even letter, Letter, Word, Standard I level text, or Standard II level text.
data: | Std | Not even letter | Letter | Word | Std I level text | Std II level text | Total |

title: Table 5: Trends over time
description: Longitudinal trends (2014, 2016, 2018, 2022, 2024) showing the percentage of Standard III children in Jammu and Kashmir capable of reading Standard II level text. The data is broken down by Government and Private schools.

title: Table 7: % Children by grade and arithmetic level. All children. 2024
